One fascinating connection is the traditional practice of controlled burns! Coast Salish peoples used low-intensity fires to manage forest understory and promote certain plant growth. Modern forest ecology now recognizes that these "cultural burns" actually:

- Reduce catastrophic wildfire risk by clearing fuel loads

- Encourage berry and nut production for wildlife
